definition: to bow in salute/to kowtow
to knock/to kowtow
old variant of 叩[kou4]/to knock
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute

sentences.english: Yes, let all kings go down before him; let all nations be his servants.
sentences.chinese: 诸王都要叩拜他，万国都要事奉他。

sentences.english: Then the handmaids came near with their children, and they bowed themselves.
sentences.chinese: 于是婢女和她们的孩子前来叩拜了。

sentences.english: And Ziba said, I humbly beseech thee that I may find grace in thy sight, my lord, O king.
sentences.chinese: 洗巴说，我叩拜我主我王，愿我在你眼前蒙恩。

sentences.english: At Horeb they made a calf and worshiped an idol cast from metal.
sentences.chinese: 他们在何烈山造了牛犊，叩拜铸成的像。

sentences.english: Then he kowtowed to the monk, to show his reverence and gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 他向僧人叩拜，表达自己的敬意和感激。

sentences.english: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.
sentences.chinese: 他们在何烈山造了牛犊，叩拜铸成的像。

sentences.english: All kings will bow down to him and all nations will serve him.
sentences.chinese: 诸王都要叩拜他，万国都要事奉他。

definition: to kowtow/to kneel and worship
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to crouch (of animal)
to kneel down
to formally call on/to worship (a God)/to pay homage to sb
to bow again/to bow twice (gesture of respect in former times)/(in letters, an expression of respect)
to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to kneel as in prayer (without sitting back on the heels)
to pray
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to salute/to make one's salutations
